revised_title: Advances in Magnetohydrodynamic Power Generation: A Comprehensive Review
tldr: This article provides a comprehensive overview of magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) power generation, discussing various types of MHD generators, their basic principles, and the challenges faced in their development. The open cycle fossil fuel system is explored in detail, focusing on issues such as flow stability, electrode longevity, air preheaters, seed recovery, and the development of superconducting magnets. The article also touches upon alternative MHD generator types, such as closed cycle systems and liquid metal systems, and their potential applications.
